snippet: New Yorkers for Parks, intensifying a campaign begun after the Sept. 11 attacks, is organizing plantings in public housing complexes and on Rikers Island with a goal to plant 250,000 bulbs this fall.
abstract: New Yorkers for Parks is organizing plantings in city's public housing complexes and on Rikers Island, hoping to plant 250,000 daffodil bulbs that will bloom in the spring as a symbol of hope and recovery from Hurricane Sandy.
lead_paragraph: New Yorkers for Parks, intensifying a campaign begun after the Sept. 11 attacks, is organizing plantings in public housing complexes and on Rikers Island with a goal to plant 250,000 bulbs this fall.

headline.seo: Daffodil-Planting Drive Gains Renewed Urgency From Storm
headline.main: Storm Lends New Fervor to Daffodil-Planting Drive
headline.print_headline: Storm Lends New Fervor To Daffodil-Planting Drive
